intro: Corsia clypeata, commonly known as the shieldflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and poor soil conditions. Corsia clypeata is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its ornamental value and low water requirements.
